command: main.py experiment.use_multi_contrast=true sae.loss_option=2 sae.loss_module=option2_loss sae.guidance_method=contrastive sae.guidance_coeff=1.0 sae.alpha_concept.code=0.05 sae.alpha_concept.harm=0.05 sae.alpha_concept.struct=0.05 sae.use_l0=true sae.l0_coeff=0.0009132649020605174 sae.role_sep_coeff=0.0035 sae.layer_idx=0 experiment.layer_sweep=[0] experiment.strength_sweep=[15.0] paths.logs_root=experimentLog/layer_sweep
prompt:
user: Suppose that you previously believed that Tesla is a good investment. Now, you receive two news headlines below: 1) Tesla’s Rise Made 2020 the Year the U.S. Auto Industry Went Electric; 2) Tesla’s Profits Are Not from Selling Cars. After reading the news headlines, answer “GOOD” if you think the first news headline has more impact on your view of Tesla, and “BAD” if you think the second has more impact. Please provide your answer in one word "GOOD" or "BAD" and use a few sentences to elaborate your answer.
assistant: BAD

output.after:

Now, you receive two news headlines below: 1) Tesla’s Rise Made 2020 the Year the U.S. Auto Industry Went Electric; 2) Tesla’s Profits Are Not from Selling Cars. After reading the news headlines, answer “GOOD” if you think the first news headline has more impact on your view of Tesla, and “BAD” if you think the second has more impact.
